intro: Curcuma karnatakensis, commonly known as the Karnataka turmeric, is a perennial herb native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the ginger family (Zingiberaceae) and is characterized by its rhizomatous growth habit. The plant produces strikingly colorful, sword-shaped leaves and clusters of fragrant, yellow-orange flowers. Its rhizomes are valued for their medicinal properties, similar to other turmeric species. The botanical features of C. karnatakensis make it a notable species in both horticulture and traditional medicine.
